attributes.action: Ban SATS testing in primary schools
attributes.additional_details: Primary school children should have the benefit of a wide education programme, without effectively being constrained by having to prepare for formal exams in Years 2 and 6. We feel that SATS cause unnecessary levels of stress in mainstream pupils, pupils with additional needs and teaching staff,  leading to behavioural issues and school refusal.
attributes.background: We would like SATS testing in primary schools to be abolished and replaced by incremental monitoring by teachers, in order to reduce stress on both pupils and staff and provide a more accurate means to measure educational achievement.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for a similar action:

End SATs for primary school children
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/652193
